    • Constructor Detail

      • UTimer

        public UTimer(float _start,
      float _dur)
        Constructor setting start time and duration relative to an external global timer T. Both time and duration assumes t=[0..1] time period. t is not clamped to a maximum value of t==1, as there are cases where it can be useful to let the timer keep running past t==1. Cases:
        • At global T, update() returns t==-1
        • At global T==start, update() returns t==0
        • At global T==(start+dur), update() returns t==1
        • Given start==0.2 and dur==0.25, T=0.25 gives t==0.2, T=0.4 gives t==0.8 and T=0.7 gives t==2
        Parameters:
        _start - Starting time (start=[0..1])
        _dur - Duration of timer (dur=0..1])

      • UTimer

        public UTimer(java.lang.String str)
